name: Chronic Mesenteric Ischemia with Collateral Vasculopathy
chief_complaint: I get severe abdominal pain after eating, and I've lost a lot of weight without trying
symptoms: Postprandial abdominal pain (30-60 mins after eating)
Unintentional weight loss (15% of body weight over 6 months)
Food fear (avoidance of meals due to pain)
treatment: Angioplasty with stenting of mesenteric arteries
prognosis: Guarded - depends on revascularization success. Untreated carries high mortality (50-80% at 2 years)
description: A rare vascular disorder where chronic insufficient blood flow to the intestines leads to ischemic damage. Unlike acute mesenteric ischemia, this develops gradually due to atherosclerotic narrowing of 2+ mesenteric arteries with inadequate collateral circulation. The intestinal mucosa becomes chronically hypoxic, impairing absorption and causing pain when metabolic demand increases during digestion.
multiple_choice: Chronic mesenteric ischemia with collateral vasculopathy
